class.name: CommitStatusPublisher
class.description: A [build feature](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/?Commit+Status+Publisher) publishing status to external system

param.name: vcsRootId
param.description: Id of the VCS root for which commits a status should be published. Set to an empty string to publish status for all VCS roots attached to a build configuration.

param.name: publisherId
param.description: Specifies to which system a status should be published

param.name: bitbucketUsername
param.description: A username for Bitbucket Cloud connection

param.name: secure:bitbucketPassword
param.description: A password for Bitbucket Cloud connection

param.name: authType
param.description: Use username / password credentials

param.name: bitbucketUsername
param.description: A username for Bitbucket Cloud connection

param.name: secure:bitbucketPassword
param.description: A password for Bitbucket Cloud connection

option.name: storedToken
option.description: Use token credentials stored in TeamCity

param.name: tokenId
param.description: The internal ID of the token to use for the connection

option.name: bitbucketServer
option.description: Publish status to Bitbucket Server / Data Center

param.name: stashBaseUrl
param.description: Bitbucket Server URL

param.name: stashUsername

param.name: secure:stashPassword

param.name: stashUsername
param.description: A username for Bitbucket Server / Data Center connection

param.name: secure:stashPassword
param.description: A password for Bitbucket Server / Data Center connection

option.name: storedToken

option.name: gerrit
option.description: Publish status to Gerrit Code Review

param.name: gerritServer
param.description: Gerrit server in the format: {server}[:{port}]

param.description: Gerrit project name

param.name: label
param.description: Gerrit label to be used, "Verified" is used if the parameter is left blank

param.name: failureVote

param.name: teamcitySshKey

param.name: upsourceServerUrl

param.name: upsourceUsername

param.name: secure:upsourcePassword
param.description: A password for Upsource connection

example.description: Enables publishing build statuses to commits in JetBrains Space.

Enables publishing build statuses to commits in GitHub.com / GitHub Enterprise. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.

Enables publishing build statuses to commits in GitLab.com / GitLab CE/EE. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.

Enables publishing build statuses to commits in Bitbucket Cloud. The password can be either user's password (not recommended) or Bitbucket app password generated by user. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.
Enables publishing build statuses to commits in Bitbucket Cloud. Instead of password authentication an access token stored in TeamCity is used.

Enables publishing build statuses to commits in Bitbucket Server / Data Center. The password can be either user's password (not recommended) or Bitbucket HTTP access token generated by user. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.
Enables publishing build statuses to commits in Bitbucket Server / Data Center. Instead of password authentication an access token stored in TeamCity is used.

Enables publishing build statuses to commits in Azure DevOps For now only personal access token authentication type is supported. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.

Enables publishing build statuses to Perforce Helix Swarm. For now only personal access token authentication type is supported. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.
Enables voting in Gerrit based on build statuses

Enables publishing build statuses to JetBrains Upsource. It is not recommended to store secure values directly in the DSL code, see [Managing Tokens](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/storing-project-settings-in-version-control.html#Managing+Tokens) section of our documentation.
